text:
Congress General Secretary Digvijaya Singh was granted bail by a local court on Saturday in connection with an alleged recruitment scam when he was Chief Minister of Madhya Pradesh during 1993-2003. Mr. Singh, along with his lawyers, appeared before the Additional District and Session Judge Kashinath Singh, a day after the court issued a non-bailable warrant against him for not turning up before it.Mr. Singh furnished a bond of Rs. 30,000.

A 169-page supplementary charge sheet was filed on Friday in the case which pertains to alleged irregularities in recruitment in the State Assembly Secretariat.

Mr. Singh has been charged with forgery, cheating, conspiracy and misuse of office as well as offences under Prevention of Corruption Act.

“The case is ‘politically motivated’ and is a fallout of the Vyapam scam [alleged recruitment scam in government jobs and also in admission to medical and dental colleges]. Even the probe committee had not found anything against him,” said Mr. Singh’s lawyer Vivek Tankha.

As the prosecution did not raise any objection to Mr. Tankha’s submission, the court granted bail to Mr. Singh. — PTI
title: Digvijaya gets bail in recruitment scam
